title: NASA’s Perseverance Rover Investigates Geologically Rich Mars Terrain
summary: NASA’s Perseverance rover is well into its second science campaign, collecting rock-core samples from features within an area long considered by scientists to be a top prospect for finding signs of ancient microbial life on Mars.

title: GHGSat taps Spire to expand greenhouse gas monitoring constellation
summary: Spire Global said Sept. 15 it will build three 16U cubesats launching in 2023 to expand Canadian greenhouse gas-monitoring operator GHGSat’s constellation.

title: Satlantis orders OHB Sweden satellites for multispectral mission
summary: Satlantis, a Spanish Earth-observation technology company, signed a contract Sept. 14 to buy two multispectral microsatellites from OHB Sweden.

title: NASA requests proposals for two ISS private astronaut missions
summary: NASA is requesting proposals for two private astronaut missions to the International Space Station in 2023 and 2024, enforcing a requirement such missions be commanded by former NASA astronauts.

title: Vast Space to develop artificial-gravity space station
summary: Vast Space, a Southern California startup founded by cryptocurrency billionaire Jed McCaleb, plans to establish an artificial-gravity space station in low-Earth orbit.

title: New launch vehicles inch towards the pad
summary: Several new launch vehicles, some years behind their original schedules, are now expected to make their inaugural launches within the next year.

title: Telespazio signs European distribution deal for NorthStar’s SSA data
summary: European space mission integrator Telespazio said Sept. 14 it has signed a deal to distribute Canadian startup NorthStar Earth & Space’s planned space domain awareness services.

title: Space Development Agency’s first launch slips due to supply chain setbacks
summary: The first launch of the Space Development Agency’s low Earth orbit satellites that had been scheduled for late September is slipping to no earlier than mid-December.

title: Starship vehicles move to next phase of testing despite issues
summary: SpaceX continues to make progress with its orbital test flight duo, with Ship 24 completing a six-engine static fire test, followed by Booster 7 conducting a 33-engine spin prime milestone. As that launch inches closer, teams ready multiple vehicles for future launches and near completion of major construction at their Starship Florida launch site.

title: Microsoft continues expanding Azure Space
summary: Microsoft is continuing to expand its role in the space sector on multiple fronts with a strategy built around partnerships.
